name: places/ChIJb65O3KVZwokRJV_oGaVFaCk
adrFormatAddress: 85 10th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA

originalText.text: Absolutely horrible experience with CLEAR lately at Newark airport. You pay for a service that’s claims expedited security yet they are always understaffed and the lines are longer than regular TSA Precheck. This advice isn’t worth any cost. In fact they should be paying the customers for waiting. I do not recommend CLEAR and if it wasn’t paid for by my CC company I’d cancel.

originalText.text: The worse service ever. I almost lost my return flight because Clear clearly lost control of the crowd. I asked for a refund over a month ago. I'm still waiting for my refund after several emails that were unanswered. The fact they don't operate in every airport also made my decision easy to cancel them

originalText.text: Just before the holidays I was traveling in Newark airport and pulled aside by a clear agent told that we were going to have free clearance and that we would not be charged. However, my credit card was charged $387. I am not happy.

text.text: Just before the holidays I was traveling in Newark airport and pulled aside by a clear agent told that we were going to have free clearance and that we would not be charged. However, my credit card was charged $387. I am not happy.

originalText.text: Clear at Hartsfield is NOT worth the cost. Line is always longer than regular TSA Pre. My last 4 flights I was random checked twice, then today had to rescan ID and answer a number of security questions as if I was just creating an account. Ive had the account for at least 10 years. So 3 out of 4 times I had to show ID and was delayed.   So I’m paying for slower service.  Maybe at other airports it’s helpful, but not at ATL.

originalText.text:
11/23 update. NextGen Identity+ is a scam. Read details. Nothing will speed your time through the line. But CLEAR will collect more date about you, from your phone and from your face. They want the data because it's valuable to them but nothing adds value for you.

You'll be stopped just as frequently (~30-50%of the time) to present id at tsa because clear.me has lax hiring standards and had staff who violated federal law.

Though I've used CLEAR ~50x per year for 6 years along with TSA Pre, I've found myself often skipping CLEAR anyways and just going to the regular Pre line because it would be faster.

The value prop for CLEAR is just not what it once was.

If it weren't free, I wouldn't pay for it. If amex platinum or my airline dropped it as a status benefit, I wouldn't sneeze. Half the time I see the line is longer for tsa+clear vs just tsa and there's a 50% chance I'll have to pull out my I'd anyways in the tsa+clear line. So basically, half thr time I fly from a us airport I skip clear anyways.
